contactmanager

Interface FileSaveRetrieve

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    FileSaveRetrieveImpl

    public interface FileSaveRetrieve
    Deals with saving ContactManagerImpl state to a string and or an external text file.
    Since:
    09 March 2015
    Author:
    Oliver Smart <osmart01@dcs.bbk.ac.uk>

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      String getFileName()
      Getter for the name of the file to read and write contactManager to
      ContactManagerPlus retrieveFromFile()
      decodes ContactManagerPlus from the current fileName, that must have been written by saveToFile.
      void saveToFile(ContactManagerPlus contactManager)
      Saves the contactManager to the current fileName (set by setFileName(String)).
      void setFileName(String fileName)
      Setter for the name of the file to read and write contactManager to/from.

    • Method Detail

      • setFileName

        void setFileName(String fileName)
        Setter for the name of the file to read and write contactManager to/from.
        Parameters:
        fileName - the name of the file

      • getFileName

        String getFileName()
        Getter for the name of the file to read and write contactManager to
        Returns:
        name of the file

      • saveToFile

        void saveToFile(ContactManagerPlus contactManager)
        Saves the contactManager to the current fileName (set by setFileName(String)).
        Parameters:
        contactManager - the ContactManager to save
        Throws:
        RuntimeException - if there is an error in encoding the contactManager
        UncheckedIOException - if there is a problem opening or writing to the file

      • retrieveFromFile

        ContactManagerPlus retrieveFromFile()
        decodes ContactManagerPlus from the current fileName, that must have been written by saveToFile.
        Returns:
        the contactManagerPlus encoded in the input string
        Throws:
        UncheckedIOException - if there is a problem opening or reading from the file
        RuntimeException - if there is a problem in opening the file, reading from it or decoding the object
